metadata.title: CVE-2019-11599 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The coredump implementation in the Linux kernel before 5.0.10 does not uselocking or other mechanisms to prevent vma layout or vma flags changeswhile it runs, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information,cause a denial of service, or possibly have unspecified other impact bytriggering a race condition with mmget_not_zero or get_task_mm calls. Thisis related to fs/userfaultfd.c, mm/mmap.c, fs/proc/task_mmu.c, anddrivers/infiniband/core/uverbs_main.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11599` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-159-generic - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-lowlatency - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-159-generic - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-159-lowlatency - 4.4.0-159.187
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1118-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1118.127
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-159.187').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
